description: I went here with a friend for breakfast.  This is what you called a throwback to the old days when the city was not overrun by tech.  The breakfast was great and I ordered coffee to go with.  The table by the window could give you a view of yachts docking at the pier.  It's such a relaxing diner where everything is about the SF Giant baseball.
author: Wing W.

description: Nice area but worst burger I have ever had. Food was tasteless and cheap. Don't pick the food. Go for the drinks and java
author: Renae A.

description:
Java House is simply a wonderful little shack alongside the bay to enjoy a nice breakfast/lunch on a sunny day while enjoying the view!

Being right by AT&T park, I can see Java House being a nice hangout spot right before or after games. The place serves typical traditional American fare such as burgers, sandwiches, omelets, salads, and pancakes. I came here for a cheeseburger once while on my afternoon stroll and enjoyed it quite a bit. There's nothing particularlly amazing about it, but all in all it is very good for a standard cheeseburger with mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomatoes, and pickles. Its taste is somewhat similar to that of an In-n-Out burger, but with a feeling of more substance and fresh flavors. At the end, the best thing about this place is definitely the charm, feel, and view. Seeing all the boats parked at Pier 40 with the ferry going by, birds in the air, and a nice breeze is very soothing and relaxing. Even hearing the sizzles of the cheeseburger patty on the grill adds to the atmosphere.

If you're looking for some delicious traditional American diner food right by the bay, Java House is definitely a nice charming place to be!
author: Joshua M.

description: Even though the old Man that owned it rain this place for so long has passed on now I still love this place today it's pancakes with fresh blueberries inside the batter not like the blue better you get at the store but pancake batter and fresh blueberries. Overlooking the boats and watching the sun come up. Life doesn't get any better than this!
author: David T.

description: Can't wait until I go to my first Giant's game this season and so I can have a beer and a burger at Java House.  Always a big fan of eating outside ATT before going into the game.  Prices reasonable.  Beats the heck out of waiting at the Willie Mays statue to meet a friend.  As the Yog once said, "No one goes there anymore, its too crowded."  The Java House is not too crowded that you can't get service quickly.  Same family has been running it for years.  The real deal.
author: Derald C.

description: Had a good BLT/drink here and enjoyed the view.  Tables outside are great when weather is good.  Some kid brought his not small dog over and the dog sat on top of the table and drooled next to me.  Not cool. However, this was dog owners fault more than cafe, but was my table drooled on?
author: Mac C.

description:
This a dumpy little shack right behind att park.  I'm going to guess it predates anything of value being within a couple miles.  Reminds me of calumet fishery in Chicago. 

I ordered a burger and asked for the cut up potatoes on the grill (probably from breakfast) instead of fries.  It was decent but unspectacular.  What I expected.  

The shack is broken up into two main sections.  A bar area and a grill with maybe 2 or 3 tables.  There are also a few tables looking out onto the bay outside.  I opted for one of these.  

They have a school directly below that gives lessons on how to navigate mini race car type sailboats. Arguably comical.  Full grown dudes in little boats shifting sails in wind using unseen controls around genital area.  Top speed about 1 mph.   There's a course to navigate through.
author: Asper K.

description: Went here about a month ago.  Great place!  Friendly atmosphere and great staff members.  Makes you feel right at home!  I'm definitely coming back and bringing friends!
author: Al C.

description: Cute spot with beautiful water view. Good food friendly staff nice atmosphere. Near the AT&T park within walking distance.
author: TeeTee C.

description:
We came to the Java House before,  but just had coffee, beer and fries on previous occasions. 

On this day we had a guest from out of town and took him to the Java House for brunch.
I had the special with Sausage, Eggs (sunny side up) and pancakes. The food was very delicious. Especially the sausages, eggs and the pepper sauce made an awesome combination.

If you get the chance to sit outside, do this. It offers a great view onto the marina and you can watch the people walking by. It tends to be busy on game days.
author: Dario S.

description: So I go to this place on Sundays and Wednesday when I'm Working at the Giants game. The mom who takes your order knows a how to do you order when you order your food and it's not exactly like it is on the menu so the price is worth it.  But when the daughter is there she charges you as it is on the menu. The food is good but you have to watch your potatoes because  sometime it's burnt. But it's a good place to go.
author: Angela L.

description:
The Java house is one of my favorite places to eat a nice breakfast in the morning, this place has been here for ages along the embarcadero.

Weather you live in the area or visiting and near by stop in and grab a bite to eat and enjoy the views of the marina on pier 40 while eating along side of the Java house, in my opinion I prefer to enjoy my breakfast out doors its peaceful and joyable during the early hours, but if there's a ball game going on you might want to avoid this place because it will be packed full of people. 

There menu is simple for breakfast and lunch, for breakfast you can get eggs, home fries, bacon, ham, hot cakes, toast (white, wheat, multigrain) etc. I usually come in for 2 eggs over easy, bacon, home fries, and mutigrain toast. For lunch you can get sandwiches, soups, and salads etc.

There is usually someone that owns the place that is at the counter taking your order and one cook on the griddle, the service is very friendly and the food is good no wonder they've been open for ages. This is a cash only establishment, if cash is needed no worries there is a atm machine on site. I will always visit this place for breakfast whenever I'm in town, I love this little spot.
author: Edwin R.

description:
Best overpriced crappy burger that I just can't get enough of!

How do I even begin to explain why I enjoy frequenting this spot. I just love it and for reasons I can not quantify. It's just a little shack near the water, but on a warm SF day there is no place I rather be to bask in the sun on lunch before heading back into work. That is if I'm in the mood for a huge greasy burger which isn't often, but perhaps more often then it should be. 

The staff are friendly and has a real Mom and Pop kind of feel. There isn't much variety at all, but you should be going there for the huge ass burger with bacon and egg with a side of fries. If you're going for anything else, you're doing it all wrong. 

It's cash only and like i said a bit over priced, but if you want a real traditional burger and some sun on your lunch break grab some friends and walk on down to the Java House.
author: Steven C.

description: Best breakfast in South Beach hands down! Great vibes to pre and post Giants game with a very friendly family run staff!
author: Philip D.

description: I was looking for food on a Sunday morning near a t and t park. Yelp led me to java house. Their site said they opened at 7 but they did not open until 8.
author: Susan F.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  Simple and great breakfast! Can't beat the view! We will return!
author: Robert C.

description:
bacon cheeseburger was delicious, as was their fries.

But the fact that they are CASH ONLY sucks monkey balls.
author: Katarina F.

description: Overpriced and cheap food. It's a cute dilapidated historic building sure, but take a photo and move on. There are much better places to eat in the neighborhood like Town's End just up the street! The coffee isn't great either. Throwing on two slices of wonderbread and slathering on industrial canned butter does not warrant a $12 check. I know it's San Francisco but dang!
author: Dominic Z.

description:
$8 beer and hot dog from the bar area of Java House. You can't beat that for a meal before catching a game next door at AT&T Park. Looking at all the other foods Java House serves up for a mean breakfast/lunch, I should of ordered from the main restaurant. 

Their burgers, and breakfast looked so good. Sit outside on a nice warm day and watching the boats, yachts go by. Eat a quick meal if you don't want to spend $$$ inside the park. 

No credit cards in the bar area, yes in the dining area. One small shared bathroom. 

GO GIANTS!
author: Ticha B.

description: Awesome place run by wonderful people!! Right outside AT&T Park and adjacent to the marina on the Embarcadero for a once-in-lifetime view! Great food and beer!
author: Jack M.

description: Mom and I just had breakfast here for the first time, it was delicious! Had an omelette, potatoes (home fries) and toast.... Mmmmmmm! Mom had a stack of fluffy pancakes, sausage, bacon and eggs.... She was satisfied and happy :) I highly recommend eating outside in front of water... It was a beautiful day and great view to everything!
author: Lavinia J.

description: Great ppl the food is delicious! U must try the pancakes! N the potatoes!! It's right by the bay so u can eat outside or inside
author: Gracia A.

description: Pretty cool little breakfast spot right on the water about 600 meters from the giants stadium, they serve breakfast and lunch.
author: John B.

description:
If you want a greasy american burger, and why wouldn't you, then I highly recommend this place. I always get the bacon cheese burger when I'm here. When ever I'm in SF, I try to get at least two visits to this place, especially if its nice weather. Sitting out side near the water having a great burger for lunch is awesome.

Btw, they now take credit card.
author: Magnus W.

description: This may not be the most fair review ever as we didn't end up eating there.  However, there is something to be said about first impressions.  We were looking for a place to eat lunch and as we hadn't been there before decided to check it out.  It was around 1:30pm on a Monday.  When we walked in there was nobody in there except a man in the open kitchen and another one sitting at a table.  He promptly got up, walked behind the counter and greeted us in a very surly and uninviting manner.  We stood right inside the door and looked at the very uninspiring menu board on the wall.  To be perfectly honest, the place looked like a dump.  We decided to leave, said "thank you" and walked out without one word from the two men.  Tip:  Maybe people will give your place another chance if you are friendly and welcome them back another time.
author: Lars S.

description: Wish I could give half stars - Java House food may be a 3, but the location, ambience and experience make it worthy of another half star. Grab an open air seat and a crab sandwich on lightly grilled sourdough, and enjoy your day by the bay.
author: Ric F.

description:
Meh...This place is just ok. 

I went to SF for a Giants game and was feeling rather hungry. This place was open so I decided to give it a try. I ordered the The pastrami on french which was really expensive for just a sandwich. Moreover, the damn thing wasn't even that good. There wasn't much flavor (had to douse that bad boy with hot sauce).
author: John B.

description:
Filthy, overpriced dump.
Pigeons from the streets on the tables pecking at the salt shakers.
Plastic chairs looks like they salvaged them from the garbage and covered in grime.
author: FLICK R.

description:
This place is inconspicuous and kinda small. The little hut style restaurant has some flair though...

I like that it seemed to be mostly family run, with the dad running around busing tables. He has an epic handlebar 'stache, so you can't miss him. 

Great place to grab some food before a Giants game. I had the lamb gyro and my b/f got eggs, toast, and bacon. (The family is Greek, so I had to have some Greek food.) Good and decently priced. The view is awesome and people are pretty friendly. 

Check out some of the stuff on the walls. This place has a really interesting history as well.
author: Lynn H.

description: GREAT pastrami sandwich and hiomemade macaroni salad. The location is awesome if you want to go to ATT Park and not spend a fortune to eat or walk around the Ferry Bullding and relax by the water. The sign says "Breakfast and Lunch" but we had dinner on a Saturday night before the Billy Joel concert
author: Michelle L.

description:
From Matier & Ross, San Francisco Chronicle, August 27, 2007...
"The little business getting jacked is the Java House, a mom-and-pop breakfast and burger joint on Pier 40, just up the street from AT&T Park. It just got served notice (from the Port of San Francisco) that its rent is jumping more than five-fold, from $800 to $4,429 a month, effective this coming Saturday."

Well, I'll just let Effie say it for me. She hasn't felt this bad since she was kicked out of the Dreams. Stand back! ...Effie's about to blow!

"What about me?...
What about how I feel?...
Where else are you gonna get a bacon cheeseburger for seven bucks?
...that many places, huh?
I'm not feeling well. I got pain...

What about them pigeons who eat the half-eaten sandwiches outside?...
What about how they feel?
Ohhh...for oh so long, I fed your ass. I was your hangover shack.
I may not be Red's but I ain't give you no blues.
And now you're telling me it's all over.
It's all over.

...and I am telling you I'm not going
I'm the best dive you'll ever know
There's no way you can ever let me go
No-no-no-no way
No-no-no-no way you're eating without me
Oh, you're not eating without me,
Not eating without me
My rent ain't free
You're staying, you're staying
And you...and you...and you...you're gonna eat here
Ohhh, hey hey, you're gonna eat here,
Yes, ah ooh ooh, eat here,
Ooh-ooh-ooh, eat here

Eat here
Eat here
Eat here
Eat here
You're gonna eeeeeaaaat (gasp!) herrrre!"

FOOD - 4 stars...so what if it's greasy and a little pricier than Red's...it ain't five times pricier!
AMBIANCE - 4.5 stars...it's a shack with a great view off Pier 40
SERVICE - 5 stars...The Papadopoulos family treats you well
TOTAL - 5 stars...go there while you still can 'cause you...and you...and you...you're gonna eat here
author: Ed U.

description:
Whether you sit at a table inside or out on one of the picnic tables outside you'll get a great view of the bay and the boats bobbing up and down on the water while being parked on the pier.  The family that runs this restaurant are super nice, laid back folks who are just plain nice to talk to.

There are copies of the Chronicle inside so guys like me who don't regularly buy a newspaper can sit and catch up on current affairs.  

Seven dollars for a bacon cheese burger is on the steep side, but it is acceptable for this area and the great view.  If you want fries with that it is an additional two dollars.  Soft drinks and beer are sold by the bottle or can.

The well done burger while being topped with a slice of cheese, a slice of ripe white onion, fresh tomato, iceberg lettuce and thick, sizzling pieces of bacon was very average in taste.  The full flavor bacon was very good, but the beefiness of the burger was quite nonexistent.  The unsalted shoestring potatoes fried to a slightly golden hue were fresh and hot but tasted more like the oil it was fried in and less like potatoes.

It's obvious I've bumped up the stars on this review despite the mediocre food mostly because I'd like to see this little restaurant here for quite some time in the future.  There really isn't too many of these family-owned businesses left in our overpriced City.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Came here with a coworker because we were really craving lunch for breakfast.  Absolutely stunning location right along the Embarcadero - on a nice day it's perfect, overlooking the bay and the giant arrow figure.

The food itself was pretty good, but slightly overpriced for a diner style restaurant.  But of course, again, the location was prime.  I got two eggs and bacon.  Plain-ish, but what do you expect!
author: Adele Z.

description:
Negative: Slow and bad service. Awful burger (that was served cold). Expensive.
Good location, on the sea, but kinda dirty.

Never, never again.
author: Marco P.

description:
I actually got confused by the name of this place... I was walking up the Embarcadero and was fiending for a cup of coffee.  I went inside and stood in line, ordered a cup of coffee, got the cup and went over to the self-service urns.  It looked promising, with fancy labels of different coffee varieties (two dark roasts and a medium)... until I discovered they were all completely empty!  Then when I got a waiter to fill up my cup for me from the table service pot in the corner (which he did superfast with no drama), afterwards he filled up the self-service urns from the same pot!  Oops... that's probably not the Ethopian peaberry medium roast they're advertising!

The coffee was... just coffee.  Which is good, because that's what I'd ordered.

Anyway, it looked like a decent diner, the staff looked energetic and friendly, and if they weren't called 'Java House' but 'Something or Other Diner' I'd probably stop back in sometime for a lunch with a view of the bay.
author: David S.

description: A group of us stopped in before the Giants game. 3 of us got cheeseburgers and 1 got a grilled chicken sandwich; the burgers were good and the chicken sandwich was okay. Saw an $8 special for a hot dog and beer but because they already had beers with them we passed on the deal.. decent place to grab a bite and have a drink outside before the game.
author: Kory R.

description: Been here before. Great burger and fries. But why does it say it's open today, 11/19/14, and discovered it was closed?  Is it because it's raining now so you think there's no business??? Smh... Still going to give you 3 stars cause I like the place.
author: Jeff T.

description:
I think I've walked by, driven by and run by this place thousands of times and never stopped in. Shame on me.

During the Giant's recent Opening Day, a friend and I walked over before the game and ordered a plate of breakfast. This place is so cute!  There's a small bar area inside off to the left with a handful of tables and a big screen on the wall. 

The ordering area is fairly small and a line forms rather quickly, but the wait is always worth it.  On a nice day, I prefer the seating area outside that overlooks the marina with AT&T ballpark in the background.

The food is yummmmy! I just had the eggs/bacon/toast/potatoes combo. So simple, yet so yummy.
author: Theresa N.

description:
Don't come here if you are a pretentious yuppie or an uptight personality disorder.  If you can't see the beauty of a old school diner run by the same family for over 30 years then walk on by.  
If, however, you love the classic diner style food served in an open casual  - fend for yourself milieu  - along with the best polish sausage breakfast in the city - then RUN to this place.  My order since 1999 - eggs over easy, crispy potatoes, rye toast dry, polish sausage.  Yeah!
author: David P.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.5 stars.

Food is 3 stars but the view is definitely 4.3 stars!

Any sunny and / or ballgame days will attract lots of people here in waves.

We came here after the game started so they could not make pancakes as the grills were too hot.

Opted for eggs with toast and potatoes that was pretty good. They don't serve iced coffee but you can make your own (ice does get melted so you should wait for the hot coffee out for a while before pouring ice on it.)

The view was serene, quiet, beautiful, and relaxing as you see all the dog walkers with their beloved dogs unable to help but walk into the shop looking for food and affection.

Service was good and very friendly. A great local Sunday spot!
author: T L.

description: Pretty good selection of drinks. But the breakfast sandwich doesn't look like much, but it is to die for! There is the AT&T ballpark in the back, and the shipyard which are both great views while your eating breakfast or lunch. I got the sparkling apple juice and the breakfast sandwich with bacon and cheese. It's nearby many locations which is great when you want to walk around after eating. Overall I give 5 out of 5.
author: Tre M.

description:
The chili cheese fries were absolutely sinful.

Great customer service.  Maria was so personable.  The food came out quickly.

Clean bathroom.  One stall.

Casual Atmosphere with outdoor seating.  We watched a nifty game of horse shoes with the glistening water and creaky boats as the backdrop.  Gorgeous, sunny day in SF.

A hop, skip, and a jump away from AT&T Park.  Java House offered a cheap bite, with friendly service before heading off to a Giant's game.
author: Elise G.

description:
If I were rating this place only for the experience of dining there on a warm, summer San Francisco day, this could be a four-star-plus place.  Situated beside the South Beach marina, you can sit outside on the Embarcadero and enjoy the sight of boats, the Bay, dogs being strolled and San Francisco strolling past.  

But on a typical day--and based on the food--it's really only a three-star place.  There are several restaurants within two blocks that do a better breakfast.  It's not that the food is bad, it's just not great.  Service is pretty much non-existent--this is one of those old-school places where you stand in line to place your order, find a table, and keep an ear peeled for your name to be bellowed.  

If you hit the South Beach neighborhood in a nice day, check out Java House.  Otherwise, look around for a place that is cleaner, more comfortable and has better grub.
author: Augie R.

description:
Greasy spoon that I'll go back to!   A place you can take your dog if the weather is cooperative and enjoy one of the city's best views for a small tab.

We had breakfast on Easter Sunday - so no crowd.  Eggs over easy, we tried the regular sausage and the polish sausage (go for it if you like a little spice).  Over easies were just right.  Home style potatoes nicely crisped on the outside.  Sourdough toast to complete.  Didn't try their coffee... always nervous about diner coffee.  I'm curious to try their sandwiches and burgers.

Friendly owners, may they live long and continue to prosper.

NB - Our dog Meebo disagrees with me thumpingly.  She says it's a 5.   I keep telling her she needs to join up and do her own reviews...
author: Bob K.

description:
Such a great place to grab a pre-game bite, people watch, and enjoy the beautiful view.  I disagree with other yelpers that the food is overpriced considering that the alternatives are overpriced ballpark food or Paragon/Pedro's type places.  

I added photos of the adorable Greek owner and a game table that will keep you entertained if you show up way before game time:)
author: Ariana L.

description: What a fun spot to visit before any baseball game! We are always running late to week-night games, and we just take a few extra minutes to stop here for a burger and a beer before we go. The service here is always very friendly. I only wish they stayed open until after the games- we really could use a cup of coffee by that point.
author: Steph F.

description: Good spot to get a cheap beer before or after a game.  Seating outside right next to the boat harbor.  The food isn't anything to rave about though.  Tasted like it was just Sysco food products cooked and put together.  The older man working the cash register and taking orders was not very friendly.  He seemed very annoyed from all the post game traffic coming in to spend money at his business???  I watched the cooks, it seemed like the couldn't make more than one order at a time.  It took over 20 minutes to get just fries.  Even though the fryer wasn't being used.  I guess they make one order a time in order and can't multitask.
author: Jack L.

description: I got the giant burger and it was pretty good. However, this place is overpriced for what you get. My burger was 10.50 and didn't include fries. This place has a mom and pop feel which is nice if you like that sort of thing.
author: Sam S.

description: Nice little place for a snack outside of AT&T ball park. Few tables but you can take to go and eat anywhere along the Embarcadero.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Love this place.  Then again, I have a huge soft spot for family-run greasy spoons and bars, so your mileage may vary.

I've never been to Java House for anything but breakfast... but I love it.  3 eggs, as ordered, with sausage and / or bacon, coffee and OJ.  +home fried potatoes.

Is there anything at all remarkable about their food?  Hell no.  It's just eggs, sides and coffee.  No Blue Bottle drip bullshit.  No fresh squeezed OJ.  It's just freaking breakfast.  Served by nice people you'll actually get to know if you're a regular.

I love taking a late breakfast with friends here... while watching folks get ready to set sail for the weekend.   Dogs everywhere outside... bright, sunny day, and perfectly generic breakfast.  What's not to love?
author: Mark B.

description:
Local establishment who have a big following of repeat customers which is not surprising as they are very welcoming here. 

Have had breakfast and lunch here repeatedly and usually go with the sausage sandwich for breakfast and the Italian sausage for lunch. The Italian sausage sandwich is on a french roll and is very hearty and juicy. 

They also make good rice krispy treats which you'll find behind you in a basket if you are facing the cash register.
author: t h.

description:
Need a place to go before a Giants game?  Well Java House is the place.  Before all the fancy places opened their doors just south of the stadium Java house was here.  
  The food is reasonably priced and tasty.  Prices have gone up since I started coming here back in 2000, but then again prices are up all over the place so its no different.  
  So for your pre line stadium giveaway fan wearing selves grab a cold one and Hamburger/Cheeseburger and maybe a side.

Decor: 3
Food:4
Service: 3

Would I go back? Yes and I have
author: Kelson H.

description:
The only thing saving it from a 1 star was the outside seating (great weather today).

$12 for a cheeseburger, fries and a can of soda? Overpriced.

There was only 1 guy working behind the counter to take orders and fix food. 2 other employees were sitting and chatting w/ patrons the whole time.

Burger was okay, fries were pretty terrible. It was as if the fryer oil was old or needed changing..
author: Ryan D.

description:
Great breakfast - Not a great place if you are trying to kill some time before a game, this place is turn and burn - they get people in and out very quick for making cook to order breakfast. 

Reasonably priced, good food, a great stop on the way to the ball park
author: Sam A.

description: This place sticks out like a sore thumb  (ok so does the public art down the street) next to the ship berth on Embarcadero. I started eating here years ago when I worked for someone who owned a decent sized sailboat. We'd hit the water at the ass crack of dawn but not before having a nice hearty breakfast at the Java House. Linguica, Potatoes, Eggs, and Sourdough toast. Pretty good deal for $6. A meal to give you your sea legs and a maritime vibe and crew to boot.
author: Kim N.

description: ....How many ways can we say tourist trap for the unwary or those trying to avoid the lines at Giants games...why throw an appetite away on this sub standard junk...if any of these...the Hi Dive, Reds Java, this one were anywhere else they would rightfully be in the trash bin...
author: jim b.

description:
If you want to save some major $$$ on food and beer before a Giants game, this spot is for you!  The owner Maria is great and the food is good for a greasy spoon (hamburgers, frys, Hot Dogs, etc).  

The location can't be beat (within walking distance to AT&T park) and they have a nice selection of canned and bottled beers as well as a few draft selections in the back.  You can also freely roam outside with a beer in a plastic cup, and the bicycle police rarely (if ever) hassle you.  I have even seen a group with a full sized keg in a garbage bag hanging out in the adjacent park!

Look out for my boys playing holy boards out front and be sure to stop by Java House for a beer and a burger before a game!
author: Trent L.

description: This place may raise their game when the Giants are in town, but on an average Monday lunchtime, no such thing. The guy who took the order was wearing earphones. There was a panhandler in the dining area. And even though there were at least three employees present and no other customers, the tables had not been cleaned recently. The burger was not terrible, but not inspired either. And since it came with no fries (and no tomato for that matter), $8 seemed overpriced.
author: Valerie W.

description: What appears to be a tiny coffee house along the harbour of South Beach (and just across from AT&T stadium) is run by the NICEST people ever and makes GREAT burgers and WONDERFUL egg salad. They serve REALLY GOOD cafe and also offer beer- including the TASTY local Anchor Steam Beer. Love this spot!!
author: Sandra A.

description: Good egg breakfast overlooking South Beach Marina and the sea of sailboats.  It's a fun place to sit outside with your dog on a nice day, many friendly dogs will pass by to visit you!  Diner (read not great) coffee but the cafe across the street serves lattes.
author: Laurel E.

description:
i walked by here on a sunday afternoon and it was packed with bicyclers stopping in for some food.  so we decided to bring the dogs here before a playdate for a quick bite.  

the atmosphere is great.  especially on a sunny, bright day.  weather along the piers can be a bit schizo.  i kept taking off and putting on my jacket.

its a self serve joint.  the tables are public.  i got three eggs and pancakes and was tempted to wipe my eggs off with a paper towel.  so much grease.  but i didnt.  i didnt want to seem like a freak.  the pancakes were ok.  syrup from packets.

it felt a bit strange drinking from red solo cups.
author: claudia y.

description: An employee from this restaurant found my phone and decided to keep it, modify my online accounts and utilize my Pandora, etc.  This phone number (4155067262) was keyed into my Facebook after the person.  What might they do to your food? How clean is this place?  If they have these morals and values then maybe not so good.
author: David A.

description:
Maria and Michael are some of the most generous people I know.  For 2 years in a row, our non-profit has used the area in front of their establishment for an event, and they have been so helpful to us throughout the day.  

This glorious mom and pop restaurant is a great spot to have a beer by the water, or grab a burger before a giants game.
author: Jayshree P.

description:
If you're looking for Red's Java House, this isn't it.

We wanted to stop by Red's before the Giants' game, but unfortunately we saw this place first and ended up here. 

At first the bf and I were optimistic. The plastic tables and chairs right outside the restaurant were filled with people who had the same idea as us - enjoying cheap food and beers before going to the game.  

The few options this place had were posted on the wall - mainly burgers and sandwiches. I ordered the veggie burger, while the bf ordered a shrimp and crab sandwich. Sounds good, doesn't it? 

Well, 15 minutes later this is what we get: a veggie patty topped with one slice of tomato and two measly pieces of romaine lettuce all between white toasted hamburger bun. THAT'S IT! No spread, cheese, extra veggies, nothing! Wow. I honestly couldn't believe it took this long to put this "burger" together. The shrimp and imitation crab (probably) sandwich was a chopped up combo of the two mixed with mayo and celery between two pieces of wheat sandwich bread. Nothing special at all. 

If I wanted to get ripped off, I would have just bought food from the ballpark!  

The only saving grace about this place is the fact that the tables outside is available for anyone's enjoyment, not just patrons of the restaurant. I actually saw a few people enjoying their own snacks and homemade sandwiches here (I made a mental note for next time).
author: Kimberly S.

description: Looooove this place.  I make it a point to get in here for breakfast when I'm staying at South Beach Harbor.  Was just here New Years Eve.  Breakfast was on the table in a few short minutes and it was hot and yummy and exactly what was ordered.  LOVE their crispy bacon.
author: J D.

description: It's close to the ball park. It's not too busy. They have beer. They have all day breakfast. They have burgers and fries, things you'd need before a game. I'm not sure if there is parking, but it is walkable to the ball park, so don't worry about it. Don't get the giant burger...it's not that giant. The giant burger could use a bigger patty and one more egg.
author: Andrew Y.

description: I go here almost every time before a Giants game. Great burgers and a great place to hang out.
author: Ryan M.

description: Great burgers and fries!! Maria knows how to just get you what you want! On those days where you're having a rough start, just ask for the hangover burger! You just need to decide if you want your onions grilled or raw! Love this place!
author: Heidi W.

description:
I live in the area and decided to check it out for breakfast this morning and I will never return. The inside is dirty and cluttered; I felt like I was in a hoaders restaurant. The chairs were dirty and even the walls, made me think about how dirty the food would be. 
The food was greasy but not like yummy greasy more like YUCK, I felt oil everywhere on my face. Total bad experience. Coffee is $2 and its CASH ONLY. I would have rather had a McDonald's breakfast.
author: Kristy A.

description:
A nice place to hang out with the locals. Good food cheap drinks and always a friendly greeting.

Yeah its a bit rough around the edges, but this is San Francisco, its by the bay, its by the ball park  and it doesn't pretend its anything else..

Once you've been in a cople of times you're treated as a friend, need some info on something local, just ask, someone will know someone involved in it, and you'll be introduced in a flash.

Goes without saying that this is a great place to hang out before Giants games.
author: Dan B.

description: First time and it was better than I could have ever imagined! The Mr. and I wanted a bite to eat before the Giants game and this was a great find. He had a simple hot dog and beer combo and I went with the three meat sandwich. Outdoor seating next to the water made our experience all the more relaxing. Also, this place had a homestyle feel between staff and guests which brought a sense of comfortability for a first timer like myself. This will be my spot anytime I'm on my way to the game! Go Giants!!
author: Bre Bre T.

description: Great option for pregame beers with a non-douchey feel that's typical to the meat markets that pepper South Beach/China Basin. Decent food and cheap beer, they also have plenty of traveler cups on hand for the road soda to go. Sunny outdoor seating as well.
author: Matt H.

description:
The owner, an adorable older man with Greek fisherman's cap walks up to me and my date as we're sitting on the dockside table with some beer. 
 
Owner to date: What kind of bait did you use?
Date [confused]: For what? [thinking he'd mistaken him for fishing off the pier]
Owner: To beautiful woman you're with, what kind of bait did you use? 

With compliments like that, who cares about the food?
author: Suzanne R.

description:
I'm not sure what kinda of cheese that yellow substance is on Java House burgers but, DAMN, that some good stuff. This is no garlic aioli & red onion confit burger.  But it's only until you have a great "regular" burger like this, that you realize that all that extra frou-frou stuff is not necessary. 

Good, greasy, no-nonsense food, a beer and an older Greek guy singing to me on a sunny afternoon = perfection.
author: Natasha R.

description:
After eating ballpark food for about 8 years now, you get tired of the same junk food they serve there.  

So me and my coworkers ended up at the Java House for a change.

The view of the pier is amazing - plus you get to see adorable pets running around (pet-friendly atmosphere is always great). 

You can sit inside or outside (yes, cheap decor but their friendly smile and pleasant small conversations go far).

Though pricey, I do like the crab & shrimp sandwich($6.50 with tax). A lot of people can complain, but after trying the one at the ballpark (talk about grease!), this one is a nice step up - plus way cheaper and possibly bigger.
author: Nina M.

description: Order the shrimp/ crab salad sandwich. It's the best kept secret here.  Better than any of the burgers or dogs that the place is famous for.
author: Paula H.

description: Friendly staff. Hole in the wall establishment. Try the huge pancakes with fresh strawberries. It gets crowded when there is a baseball game.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Really good hamburgers. I got two plus 2 beers and fries for 24 dollars.
author: Miguel F.

description:
I came here with my dad for a beer and hot dog before the park (seeing as how i would have had to pay over $40 for us each to have one in the park).  They have a deal that comes with a hot dog and beer... but if you have read any of my other reviews you will know that I ONLY drink Anchor Steam (that is until I cant tell what im drinking anymore and have lost the taste).  It was cheap and did the job.

Only downside was the HUGE crowd of WASTED high schoolers that were yelling at eachother about weed and drinking rum out of water bottles.  So YOu can bring your own alcohol but im sure they are nto happy about it, but clearly did not say anything.  Not down for my dad to see the city youth and their lameness!  I mean honestly i dont want to know all of their business.

So other than having to yell over them, they had Steam beer, so Ill deffs go again some time before a game of course.
author: Megan L.

description:
Pros: Staff is colorful, Nice view, Outdoor seating
Cons: Food is average, Not particularly cheap, Dive

The guy in front of me had dark hair and non-middle-american features. 

COUNTERGUY: Where are you from?
GUY: Uh, Cleveland. My parents are from Macedonia
COUNTERGUY: OH! You're GREEK then! 

Counterguy then gave him a massive discount. And proceeded hover over him the whole time he ate.

I swear on my mother's grave (she's not dead yet and still attracting men 20+ years her junior, but I digress, it's a handy saying), this really was the conversation he had with the counterguy. It totally could have been a scene from "My Big Fat Greek Wedding".
author: Matt W.

description:
This is a great place to hang out before a Giants game, or like we did, just chill here on an unusually warm Sunday evening.

Last night, the weather was really balmy, so we decided to eat outdoors.  We walked along the Embarcadero and decided to check out this spot.  Being that it was right before the start of a Giants game, all the outdoor seats were filled, so we stood and chilled for a while, but were able to enjoy the eye candy while we waited.

Finally, a seat opened up, so we enjoyed the burgers and fries here.  They were tasty....not gourmet and the fries were a little greasy, but not too bad....I'd call this place above average for food, but great for scenery.
author: Aaron M.

description: This little dive is a great place to hang on a sunny weekend afternoon.  Good burgers, beer, sunshine and views (water and otherwise).
author: p w.

description:
A very cool place to grab some cheap grub and beers before a Giants game.  If you're not going to a game or just coming off your yacht or something, I cant really see a reason to come here.

The place is full of character(s)...The more than slightly Borat-ish looking gentleman behind the bar, the sassy but friendly girl working the counter, the Dad/owner with whom we had the shortest conversation ever.
He: Beautiful day
Us: Oh yeah, a lot better than last night.  Weird that it rains in May, isn't it?
He: Mmmgh (walks away)

All that being said, the food is decent.  Not spectacular, but again, as far as the value for filling up before a Giants game and not mortgaging your house for a beer and burger at the park , this place is a winner.
author: Ken V.

description: Service wasn't very good and the place is kind of a dump. That all would be fine if the food was off the charts, but it's definitely not. Do yourself a favor and go to Towns End across the street - you'll pay a bit more, but the quality, service, and atmosphere is miles beyond this place.
author: Mike M.

description:
Greasy oily spoon!

I ate here appx 2 years ago for breakfast and said I would never eat here again.  However, my husband convinced me to go this morning that it wasnt that bad?  Yes it was.

I had the 3 eggs, sausages and potatoes with toast.  My over easy eggs must have just been flipped as they were very runny.  I had one bite of the potatoes and it tasted like I drank a teaspoon of grease.  The sausages had the same taste and were overcooked and hard.

There was a petrified fly stuck to the window blinds in a nice layer of dust.  Probably stuck there from 5 years ago.
author: May M.

description:
I HATE to love the Java House. But I do. I'm like a sick puppy running back to it's abusive relationship! Weird. I know. 

The Java House's food is by no means extraordinary. I wouldn't even really say it's good. It's like fast food, but with better ingredients. And if you think I mean organic, you are soooooo wrong. 

But - before I Giants game?? I LOVE LOVE LOVE to hate the Java House. And LOVE LOVE LOVE to get my chili cheese burger groove on! It's about 50 paces from the ball park itself, and it's literally right on the water. I'm a California organic girl, and yet I sit outside, right on the water, downing the chili burger like there's no tomorrow while drinking Sierra Nevada out of a red plastic cup. There's something about their greasy, no frills, food in plastic baskets that just ramps me up to root the Giants to victory. I can't quite say what it is, but it's tradition! And it will never die.

My boyfriend asked me where I wanted to go before the game on our nine month "anniversary", if you will. And I said "Java House!"
author: Mindy L.

description: Very good greasy cheesburgers.  And I like "hole in the wall" establishments such as this.  It's an honest place, with no airs.  And with a beer, the view, and the stadium sounds in the background, what's not to like?  Well maybe the TV reception inside during the Giants game could be a little clearer.
author: Eric B.

description:
"Meh, I've experienced better" sums it up pretty well - this little place is cute, and it's located right by the dock as well as a nice patch of lawn. 

The only thing I've eaten here is the BLT and fries, because I don't really feel like the place is too clean. Everything seems greasy and sticky.

It's also pretty expensive for what it really is that you're getting. I think you have to pay extra for the fries, which makes the cost add up quickly, and I never want to use the big refillable ketchup & mustard bottles because they are always crusty and soiled looking.

I've enjoyed my food here a few times, but the mental block is hard for me to overcome. It's kind of gross! Also, I think it's cash only, so you have to eat the ATM fees if you didn't come prepared.
author: Heidi G.

description:
So the hubby and I slept over our friends place at the Golden Gateway Apts.  We decided to have breakfast the next morning, so she took us here.  This is where she usually has breakfast.  She knows my husband is definitely not a fufu person.  It's a cool place that serves your typical breakfast, nothing fancy and nothing that stood out just your typical breakfast.

If you prefer a waitress to come and take your breakfast order, this is not the place.  You go up and order and they call your name.
author: Victoria R.

description:
Good greasy spoon fare.

Mostly, I liked the owner who told me it was okay to bring my pooch inside. "Most people who come in here are dirtier than dogs" she tells me. 

I also liked the the old man behind the counter who took our order then fired it up. "Stop the bullshittin' and order" he tells me as I gab with the woman about dogs and our matching Le Sport Sacs.

Even though our pup was allowed inside we decided to eat water side and soak up the day. We had breakfast, the bacon was overcooked and the pancakes were heart-failure-abulous. The eggs... Well, they were definitely eggs.

If I lived closer I would frequent this place more regularly and drink beer outside and try their burgers. I loved the old school family charm of the place. I would absolutely go back to be put in my place again.
author: Jessica M.

description: I've been a couple times for an early AM weekday bacon-egg-and-cheese sandwich, and must say it hits the spot.  I'm usually one of only two or maybe three people in the place around 7am, and they have time to treat me well, cook the chow with care.  Can easily see it having a different mode during more crowded hours, but if you can get in and be THE customer, its pretty good.  Cant beat the location/scenery.
author: Lanny B.

description:
The Mayor is key here. If you're lucky enough to get into an extended conversation, relish it - the man is a genuine old-school curmudgeon. Hall of Famer on the moustache alone. 
He told me I should marry my girlfriend and have a kid. I did. It was excellent advice. 
The breakfast here is rock-solid griddle fare. Sometimes the crispy egg-sandwich bread cuts the roof of my mouth. I don't mind the pain. Unlimited coffee and a great bunch of seats outside. 
 p.s. but yo - isn't the zip code 94107?
author: Josh M.

description:
Things I like about Java House:

1. My office just moved two blocks away.

2. My other prospective-go-to lunch spots were places like Jack Falstaff, Paragon, Momo's (puke, lame, barf, respectively). Naturally JH appeared to me, as if in a dream, like a shining beacon of hope or shimmering jewel of the Mediterranian (SF BAY).

3. The location/view. Duh.

4. The squeeze bottles of blood-thin ketchup.

5. The greasy fries that harken back to the days of yor (the burger shack at Olympic Club golf camp circa puberty).

6. The modern-day pirates sitting shoulder to shoulder around the table next to me.

7. Next to the pirates, the SF Bay Boater's Guide hanging on the wall.

8. Next to that the 8.5X11 ad for a "Boat for Sale: 1984 37' Hunter Cutter." HUNTER CUTTER.

9. The Java.

10. The overheard conversation. Grizzled dude number 1 affectionately tells grizzled dude number 2 about his cousin, "a bigwig at the post office."

11. The mustachioed maniac who takes your order and then calls your name when your fewd is ready. Compounded by the fact that I got to hear "KIP!" and "SKIP!" yelled in a Greek accent on the same day.

12. The sign that says "Greek Parking Only" above the window. Aside from the white exterior with blue trim, this has got to be the only Greek thing about the place.

13. This guy was there:  http://www.wildnatureimages.com/images%203/060307-036..jpg

14. The fact that the breakfasts (which are served for lunch too) are all of the three-egg varietal. There is no 2 eggs any style.

15. The ratio. When I left there were 24 other people eating there. 23 of them were dudes.

16. The have Fat Tire.

17. The fact that I could list off another 30 right now.
author: Nicholas E.

description: I would give this place 2-1/2 stars if I could as, honestly, I prefer Red's Java House (we went here for breakfast as Red's was closed for the holidays).  The food wasn't bad (eggs, pancakes, bacon), but I didn't like that two flies were hovering over us the whole time we were eating.  It was ok, but I think next time, I'll call ahead to make sure Red's is open.  Sorry!
author: Maile N.

description:
This is a pretty average diner-type place, but can be hard to find these days. The atmosphere is quite neat -- the view is great and the type of people there are what you'd expect at a diner. It's not Starbucks. But the uncomfortableness and hubbub might have you rushing to finish your food rather than enjoying the location. 

Everything on the menu is just a little over-priced for the standard diner fare.
author: Chris L.

description:
Phil & Sintoria (I know I've spelled her name wrong, sorry) are wonderful owners of the Java House near Pier 40, between Pier 40 & the South Beach boat harbor. I've recently tried their veggie omelet twice, and know that they'll customize it if you ask. I'm told the pancakes and the other breakfast items are equally good.

In the past 7 years, I've eaten breakfast here many times. One of the things I've noticed is that when it's too cold/windy to sit outdoors, and customers go to the north room to eat, it's very untidy in there. There is an ATM machine (no c/c accepted at the counter), a large-screen tv, and lots of things piled up around the perimeter of the room. While their storage space must be scant (this IS a very small eatery), surely something could be done about the clutter. 

As far as I know, the cooking areas and the restrooms are well maintained and sanitary. It's just the second room that bothers me. Solution? Eat outdoors facing the harbor!!!!!

Oh and the fact that the owners/personnel DO chat with the customers and have a rather laid-back attitude: That goes a long way with me. This is not a fast-tood place, and there's no pressure here. Take your time & enjoy it.
author: joyce h.

description: ummm, yeahhh...twice in one week! the sunshine, the food, the view, the service, the company. love this place.
author: Nicole O.

description: This place is disgusting.  Food is greasy, overpriced and burnt.  It's better that you give me $10, and I can make a better breakfast at home that can outbeat Java House.  Not to mention the weird old guy there saying the weirdest things to me.  Not coming back at all.
author: Yun W.

description: Place is pretty much a dump. Food was OK, but wow, they really need ro reinvesr a few bucks.
author: josh m.

description:
Great, great food. Right on the water and the staff is as friendly as can be. As soon as you walk in you feel like you're at a family reunion. 

Good food, friendly atmosphere and just overall good. Maybe if you're lucky you'll see a few baseball players here. Even they know how good this place is.
author: Chris P.

description:
Great place to grab breakfast on a sunny Sunday morning.  Just be ready to wait 20-30 mins for your food.  However, the view and the fact that you can sit outside with your dog almost makes up for it.  I guess you could just bring a newpaper to read.

The food was just OK.  The hashbrowns are actually home fries (not what I was expecting) and the bacon was a little overcooked.  

One more thing - bring cash.  They don't take credit cards.
author: Nina L.

description: location south beach convenient...bike embarcadero and stop...plenty outdoor seating tables and by grass...bite and coffee wanting....short line and order...wait for name calling....waiting with atleast coffee...waiting past twenty minutes...waiting past forty minutes..seemingly unorganized chaos..seeing orders forgotten..others complaining..finally receiving worst breakfast sandwich...for price almost unacceptable...eggs overcooked dead...trio tiny pinky-sized split hard horrible sausages...watching other items during wait....pancakes small and flat...eggs killed one after another...
author: Hen A.

description: This is better than Red's down the road.  Staff are nice and friendly as well.
author: H C.

description: Great place to go for a burger or hot dog and a beer before entering the ballpark.
author: H K.

description: Maria and the entire Java House family are some of the nicest people in the city! They were so accommodating, and the coffee and food is perfect before the game, or if you're just chillin' out on the pier. They also have a full bar and a great view.
author: Nishu B.

description:
Eggs, potatoes, sausage and toast.

The well aged Italian guy behind the counter reminds me of my Pa Bill.  So the order was a little wacky.  The food was still good as you can't really mess up eggs, potatoes, sausage and toast.

Bring a sweater if you eat outside as you'll never know what SF weather will throw at you.
author: Po L.

description: Ugh, the java house. The java house is a stones throw from where I work so I've been there for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast is mediocre at best and definitely not worth the cost. Lunch is very expensive ($10) for a burger, you add 5 more dollars for fries and a soda and I've regretted not going to Red's Java House. Avoid this place if you can and go to the superior Reds or even Carmen's.
author: Mark C.

description: The last authentic San Franciscan cafe. I feel honored to support this small, local business.
author: N I.

description: Kind of what you would expect - greasy spoon type of food.  Nothing memorable but we can bring our dog and its a great place to sit and eat on a warm Saturday morning.  The crusty old skipper captain guy did ask if he could give our dog some toast from a plate.  At least he asked.  He didn't appear creepy to me.  I actually thought he added some character to the place.  Skip the coffee.
author: Jeff M.

description: Fantastic view and none of the bullshit that usually comes along with it. We bought beers after the Giants game and as my boyfriend got carded, I asked the older men serving if they needed mine as well and one of them told me I was beautiful and that beauty was my ID. TOTALLY going back to Java House!
author: Maria D.

description: Unfortunately, I am going to have to disagree with Liz on Java House being a great greasy spoon diner. If what you are looking for is a sinfully delicious breakfast, I would not recommend JH. Yes, the scenery is beautiful and the atmosphere is one of a kind. It is rare to find a place in San Francisco where you order from a menu of under 10 choices (all of which are essentially 3 eggs with 1 added ingredient) and where a woman from a different room calls out your name and waits for you to fetch your order. However, if I would have gone out of my way to have an omelet here I would have been very disappointed that all I was getting was 3 eggs and the wierdest orange synthetic cheese. Maybe the pancakes and bacon would have been a better options so I will give this place another chance when the weather is nice enough to sit outside. But.... in the end. . . it was only 5 bucks. ;)
author: Nicole L.

description: Quick, average prices (for the area) and good. What's lacking in the indoor atmosphere is made up for by the picnic benches with bayside views outside. It's hard not to support a family business like this one, especially when the port authority has been giving them so much grief this year...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Not to be confused with Red's which is very close by.  The Mayor of South Beach knows how to do breakfast and in this area it's warm enough to eat outside by the water.  They also do a burger/fries/beer special during Giant's games.  I imagine it's better than most of the food inside Pac Bell Park.
author: T-Bone L.

description: $6 for a beer and a burger on the way to the game and you are set.  This is certainly staple of my walking/drinking/eating route on the way to a ball game.
author: Chard M.

description: It's tradition for my son and I to eat cheeseburgers here before we go to the game. Maria is usually behind the counter and she's warm and gracious. We eat outside near the boats. The burgers are great. I have many fond memories of eating here.
author: Michael R.

description: A real landmark. Go there for the real thing. And this isn't just about Eddy's personal cooking style, it is also about Phil's moustache and the outstanding sunrise breakfast views...
author: Benoit B.

description: Go for the breakfast and the view of the bay on Sunday mornings. 'nuff said. Nice people too!!
author: Jboogie X.

description: This place has been around forever.  The owner can be a bit grouchy, but the food is good...  The bathroom is pretty gnarly, though...
author: Nathan W.

description: I have been coming here for years. My father has a boat docked right there. They have become very close to our family. Phil is a wonderful guy. I love the hotdogs here, almost better than a ballpark dog. The fact you can go and bullshit in a old school spot is a great place to me!
author: Jennifer O.

description: I havent had a gyro since leaving chicago and this place really hit the spot... probably took a couple years off my RealAge but I can try and counter it with a box of franzia tonight
author: Ian H.

description: A diner? On the Bay? In San Francisco? With a nice old Greek guy to serve you and give you a hard time? Who'll even take a picture for you? It gets no better my friends. 3 eggs, real potatoes, toast and beef pattie plus a cup o'coffee and I'm sold! Soon to be on of my favorites! I just love San Francisco...
author: Marc M.

description: Solid friendly Giants people.  If it's the fourth inning or so - ask if they've got any spare tickets and you might be going to the game.  GREAT for lunch in the sun - burgers are just the burgers, but the Marina is sweet.  Not the Marina neighborhood - this is the opposite of that.  Burger & beer specials under $10 on the water in the sun.  Yes, please and with a couple of friendly Greeks too, awesome.
author: .Hazel T.

description: Overpriced, but outside seating in good weather is somewhat wroth it.  The burger was well-prepared, the Coke was cold, the sun was shining, what else do you need in San Francisco?
author: Iggy V.

description: The food is average to good but the "Mayor" of Java House is a good guy and use to live in Concord, NH, so I like giving the place my business.  If I feel like getting eggs and potatoes for lunch this is my go to place and I also occasionally order sandwiches there.  Just watch out for the occasional flock of pigeons if you sit outside.   I remember one time getting up to grab some napkins and turning around in shock and watching from the distance a dozen pigeons destroying my sandwich.   I was hungry so I deliberated for about 30 seconds whether I wanted to eat the sandwich that the pigeons were pecking all over and I think one or two crapped on or if I wanted to wait for another sandwich to be cooked.  I decided to ask if it was possible to get another sandwich and they gladly made me another sandwich.
author: Josh K.

description: This is the best place to go before a Giants game. They also do a pretty good breakfast. Their burgers and dogs are delicious and they even have special before a game where a burger and a beer is $6.  $6 doesn't even get you a beer at MoMo's.  You can always pick up a ticket here on the cheap as well.   Check with Maria to see if she has extras much better than trying to scalp a ticket.
author: Brian B.

description: I like going here for lunch a lot. The gyro's are awesome and they cook the meat fresh. The burgers are pretty typical greasy burgers but they are good. Their fries are usually a little under-cooked but edible. Also you can get an awesome omelette here. The staff is always friendly and hilarious.
author: andy c.

description: bad bad service.  Had to wait 30 minutes for pancakes!  And then they were completely unapologetic and didn't even care.  And on top of that, they weren't even good.  Seriously, this place does not deserve your business.
author: J S.

description: I was so surprised to see these negative reviews as I absolutely love this place. The pancakes are usually incredible. I have been a number of times and the service is not always perfect but that is due to the extremely casual and relaxed feel to the place. Great place to be on a nice morning or afternoon. I have not been recently but I actually miss it a lot.
author: Barrett D.

description: $6 dollar breakfast with a million dollar view. Once you get past the mayor of South Beach  eat along the water front for the true experience. Avoid on baseball game days.
author: Albert C.

description: I like to hit up the Java House when I am hungover... They make a very decent bacon cheeseburger here. The fries are ok... I suggest getting them "crispy". If you eat outside make sure you don't leave your food unattended as the birds will surely take off with it. Seriously...
author: A W.

description: I've been here a couple times for lunch and one time for breakfast. Love the outdoor seating on a sunny day. Five stars for the burgers and the french fries. Soft and fresh buns. American cheese and thick bacon. Skinny crispy fries with lots of salt - oh yeah! Three stars for the breakfast sando. Not enough cheese and the egg was kinda overcooked. So...I guess that gives Java House four stars on average. Oh - and the greek people behind the counter are awesome! Between Java House and Red's, I say Red's for b-fast, JH for burgers. YUM!
author: Kate S.

description: Great, inexpensive joint for a quick breakfast at any hour, preferrably on a sunny day. Food is decent, but nothing to write home about..., unless my mom is reading this review. What do you expect for $6?.
author: Jon b.

description:
This is a wonderful, family-run establishment. According to today's (8/27/07) Chron, the Port of San Francisco is raising the rent on this place from $800.00/mo. to $4,400/mo., so take advantage of their beautiful location and delicious greasy-spoon meals while they last. The owner, Phil Papadopoulos, and his family are incredibly welcoming and always thank me for my business. On my second visit, the woman at the counter apologized when she had to ask me to remind her of my name. It is the perfect place to sip a savory cup of coffee or a cold beer and pretend like you're on The Wire (complete with "The Greek!"). 
As for the grub, I live 3 blocks away and have eaten here several times. I always order the wheat toast to save face when I get a bacon omelette, but secretly I get the toast because they serve it warm and slathered in  butter. I guess the food is pretty average, but there's just an element of homness to it that you wind up craving. I'd much rather eat here and be greeted with a smile than go out to some fancy brunch at Foreign Cinema and get treated like crap. 
I will really miss this place.
author: Heather K.

description: Aside from the location, this place is, as my roommate says, "perfectly average". The food, the coffee, the prices, everything, minus the location, is consistent and always alright.
author: Dave M.

description: This place is a no bullshit, hole in the wall, greasy spoon diner, but with michelin star views of the bay and dockside tables (of the picnic variety).  I came for breakfast and to nurse a hangover.  The coffee and cheese omelet were both successful in doing so.  While I normally would have ordered egg whites, I felt that this would not only insult the chef, but also result in my banishment forever.  Boy did it make me remember how good a 3 egg omelet can be!  The food is above average for costing only $5.50 and the coffee was especially excellent!  Pretty much, you get what you pay for with the food, but the location is worth a whole lot more.
author: Liz Y.

description: Greasy, maybe a little musty. Not quite rancid. Very nice old guy is a vibe both friendly and weird.
author: Wangston P.

description:
wonderful family affair...super greek hospitality..love it! surrounded by all this new and upcoming place, refreshing to have a real cafe with the best view of SF! 

Love that they are true to their clients...it's really our breakfast joint. They could charge us more,...but they don't...an institution...

The BEST...don't tell anyone....shhhhhh
author: Liz D.

description:
they make a damn fine bacon cheeseburger.  not the best in the world but a damn fine bacon cheeseburger nonetheless.  the breakfast is pretty good as well.  i have a greasy dripping mess of a burger in front of me which is the way it should be.  there really isnt much to say about a place like this but that i hope it dont go away anytime soon.  
i had breakfast there last week and the heart clogger, i mean bacon cheeseburger today.   good joint fair prices canned beer yep this is my kind of place.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
Best place to go before Giants game, especially day games: 3 eggs & bacon and  2 bottles of Bud is THE breakfast of champions (while sitting inside & reading the morning paper, looking at the boats completely free of the presence of morons with their laptops or other devices).  
$7 for a beer and a decent hot dog (usually x2 so I'm not tempted to buy food in park) great deal before night games.  
Burgers & sandwiches fine for the price.
Great atmosphere inside, hasn't changed for years, very comfortable, homey (& Greek!!)
Outside can be very pleasant, but can get windy in summer; best during Sep/Oct games & before Emerald Bowl .  To sit there before Giants game with your own food & not buy anything inside is horseshit.  These people are running a business & making a living, not running a free picnic ground.  There's plenty of space for that along the Embarcadero.  Java House is favorite among SFPD so non-customers will not win any arguments over seating
author: Ernie S.

description: We just went here for breakfast. The sausage was yummy. The eggs, scrambled, were tender and not overcooked. They weren't salted enough but that's easily rememedied by ketchup and table salt. The potatoes were crispy, and sourdough toast was delicious. This place is much tastier than Red's Java House up the street, and also has a nicer view and more pleasant ambiance.
author: Julia Z.

description: I'm done with this place.  looks like i may not be the only one.  been going here for many many years and its just not good anymore.  service is really bad, even when its not busy, the place looks a lot dirtier, the prices are double what they were a few years ago and the food was barely just OK.  and why is there a dog sitting on a seat at the table inside?  i'll be finding a different place to get breakfast before games, Mcdonalds would be a way better choice.
author: Frank S.
